intro: Olearia incondita, commonly known as the New Zealand frostflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and has adapted to the harsh, windy conditions of its habitat. Its foliage is usually covered in fine, silky hairs, which help protect it from desiccation. Olearia incondita is an important component of the local flora and is often used in horticultural displays due to its ornamental value.
